title: How to Make Dried Apricot and Date Logs

steps.headline: Place the apricots and dates into a saucepan.
steps.description: Cover with water and cook until soft. Do not let the water evaporate or the fruits will burn. Once cooked, drain and remove from heat. Transfer to a bowl.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl of soft fruits.
Mix well and add more water if needed, gradually.
Roll the mixture into log shapes, using the palms of your hands.
steps.description: The log lengths should be about 4 centimeter (1.6 in) in diameter.

steps.headline: Roll the logs in extra coconut.
Wrap in plastic wrap or wax paper.
steps.description: Place in the refrigerator to harden. They should remain chilled for at least 12 hours. If you are concerned about fridge odours, place the logs in an airtight container before chilling.

steps.headline: Remove and cut into small log slices.
steps.description: If it is easier to do this earlier, that is also fine.

steps.headline: Store in an airtight glass jar.
steps.description: Wrap separately for taking hiking, putting in lunch boxes etc.

text: Place the apricots and dates into a saucepan. Cover with water and cook until soft. Do not let the water evaporate or the fruits will burn. Once cooked, drain and remove from heat. Transfer to a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl of soft fruits.  Mix well and add more water if needed, gradually.  Roll the mixture into log shapes, using the palms of your hands. The log lengths should be about 4 centimeter (1.6 in) in diameter. Roll the logs in extra coconut.  Wrap in plastic wrap or wax paper. Place in the refrigerator to harden. They should remain chilled for at least 12 hours. If you are concerned about fridge odours, place the logs in an airtight container before chilling. Remove and cut into small log slices. If it is easier to do this earlier, that is also fine. Store in an airtight glass jar. Wrap separately for taking hiking, putting in lunch boxes etc. Finished.
